Welcome to pretalx's documentation

pretalx is an open source conference management tool – it allows you to create Calls for Participation, customise them, read and review submissions, choose your conference's talks, schedule them (on as many days and in as many rooms you need), and release versioned schedules. And it can do even more – check the features page for details.

We work a lot to make our documentation as up to date, usable and complete as possible. We want you to be able understand, use, run, and improve pretalx, but of course, this website will never be perfect, or even comprete. If there is anything unclear or specifically missing, we'd be happy if you'd let us know.

Documentation structure

Administrator documentation

You want to install and maintain pretalx on your own server? Read about different ways to set things up.

API documentation

You want to interact with pretalx using its RESTful API? We've got you covered.

Developer docs

You want to contribute to pretalx, either to fix bugs, or to introduce that feature you're missing? Setup instructions and helpful instructions are over here.

Table of contents

A list of everything in our documentation. Don't forget to let us know if you can't find something!

Useful links

pretalx is open source – you can find the complete source code here, and some related projects in the same GitHub organization.

Project blog

Any relevant news about releases (and pretalx in general) will be presented in our blog.

Twitter
